content: r42 cast off 2 st p44 sts r43 cast off 1 st k43 sts back panel worked flat r44 cast off 1 st p42 sts join a new thread r45 cast off 1 st k41 sts r1 k54 sts across r46 cast off 1 st p40 sts r2 p54 sts across r47 k to end 40 sts r3-12 repeat r1&2 r48 p to end r13 k54 sts cast on 7 sts k20 sts cast on 7 we r49-56 repeat row 47 & 48 will now continue working in the round place your r57 cast off 1 st k39 sts beginning of round stitchmarker r58 cast off 1 st p38 sts r59 cast off 1 st k37 sts midsection worked in the round 88sts r60 cast off 1 st p36 sts r1 k60 sts decrease 1 st k18 sts decrease 1 st k6 86sts r61 cast off 2 sts k34 sts r2 k to end r62 cast off 2 sts p32 sts r3 k60 sts decrease 1 st k16 sts decrease 1 st k6 84sts r63 cast off 3 sts k29 sts r4 k to end r64 cast off 3 sts p26 sts r5 k60 sts decrease 1 st k14 sts decrease 1 st k6 82st r65 cast off 26 sts r6 k63 sts p2 k2 p2 k2 p2 k9 sts finish off and sew in your ends r7-15 repeat r6 r16-34 k59 sts p2 k2 p2 k2 p2 k2 p2 k2 p2 k5 legs worked in the round sts pick up 32 sts around each leg evenly spaced 8sts each side ** you can cast off the jacket here or you can r1 k2 p2 to end continue and make the long back r2-8 repeat row 1 r9 cast off r35 k55 sts cast off 26 sts 56 live sts **i added a crochet edging around the back edge of the jacket to stop it from curling
